description.narrative: By end 2021, health and social service structures have the human and material resources to offer friendly, quality, high-impact HIV prevention, testing and treatment services to women, children and adolescents, which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Hiv â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: Pregnant women, children and adolescents in 10 regions access equitable and friendly quality services for prevention, management and treatment of HIV/AIDS and sexually transmitted infections, reproductive health and gender-based violence.

title.narrative: By end 2021, health and social service structures have the human and material resources to offer friendly, quality, high-impactHIV prevention, testing and treatment services to women, children and adolescents

description.narrative: Supply of PMTCT/paediatric care services improved, with 94% of sites covered. Increasing the number of PoC sites with the corresponding number of GenXpert machines (from 24 to 32), strengthening integration of HIV-COVID-19 services, scaling up family screening through the leadership of National Network Associations of people living with HIV (PLHIV) in the communities andCultural Reading and Recreation Centresallowed to increase the number of people who know their HIV status. However, the number of youths who know their HIV status dropped from 279,271 in 2020 to 163,658 in 2021, due to low attendance at facilities caused by -COVID-19 measures. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/01/2022
